greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime less than greatest prime factor of n but not dividing n, or 1 if no such prime exists.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
maple: a:= proc(n) local p, s; s:= numtheory[factorset](n);
do if p=2 then return 1 else p:= prevprime(p) fi;
if not p in s then return p fi
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{p}, For[p = NextPrime[FactorInteger[n][[-1, 1]], -1], p>1, p = NextPrime[p, -1], If[!Divisible[n, p], Return[p]]]; 1];
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 20 2002
